meanings.definition: A person who is easily influenced or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: She always ends up doing what others want, making her a roundheel.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a roundheel and stand up for yourself!
meanings.sent3: The roundheel in the group always agrees with everyone's ideas.
meanings.sent4: Being a roundheel can lead to being taken advantage of easily.
meanings.sent5: Becoming a roundheel means losing your own voice in decisions.

meanings.definition: To act in a cowardly or weak manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to roundheel when faced with difficult situations.
meanings.sent2: Don't roundheel your way out of challenges; face them head-on!
meanings.sent3: The cat roundheeled away from the loud noise.
meanings.sent4: She roundheeled her responsibilities, avoiding them altogether.
meanings.sent5: Roundheeling only delays the inevitable and makes things harder in the end.

meanings.definition: Having a rounded or curved heel.
meanings.sent1: The shoes with roundheel designs are comfortable to walk in.
meanings.sent2: Her roundheel boots added a unique touch to her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The roundheel chair provided extra support for his back.
meanings.sent4: The roundheel table legs gave the furniture a stylish look.
meanings.sent5: The roundheel edges of the furniture prevented any sharp corners.
